channel.title: New Fonts
channel.description: I'm trying to make the new level up interfaces and I need to add the fonts for it. I have the images for it and I added them into my cache with the rest of the fonts. Now how would I make it so I can use it on an interface? I tried adding it like 'smallText' but it crashes my client once it opens.

item.title: New Fonts
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:6, topic:434007”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=536724.msg3924459#msg3924459 date=1330068402]

Mine looks like this:

TextDrawingArea aclass30_sub2_sub1_sub4s[] = { smallText, aTextDrawingArea_1271, chatTextDrawingArea, aTextDrawingArea_1273, bigText }; RSInterface.fonts = aclass30_sub2_sub1_sub4s;

And everything is fine until I add this:

With the other ones.

It’s because that method loads the font from the cache, and since there’s no “level_up_font” in the cache, it fails to load.
[/quote]

I added it though.[/quote]

With the correct format, and hash name?

Read full topic

item.title: New Fonts
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Bitmap fonts are still used in the client iirc.
The interface picks the fonts from the client and a first step would be overriding a font.

Read full topic

item.title: New Fonts
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

3lv3n snip3r:

I’m trying to make the new level up interfaces and I need to add the fonts for it. I have the images for it and I added them into my cache with the rest of the fonts. Now how would I make it so I can use it on an interface? I tried adding it like ‘smallText’ but it crashes my client once it opens.

You have to include the font when the fonts are set in the interface. There’s something in the client class that does

final Font[] interfaceFonts = new Font[] {
    p11Full, p12Full, b12Full, q8Full
};
InterfaceDefinition.setFonts(interfaceFonts);

Note that those are renamed, but you can simple search for “p12_full” to get the approximate area.

Just instantiate the font, add it to the font[] and you should be good to go.

The reason that the error exists is because the interfaces load the font as an index in the font[]. If an interfaces tries to load a font that isn’t in the array, an error occurs.

Read full topic
